intro: Schiedea stellarioides var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf schiedea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are linear and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. This variety is notable for its unique morphology and is considered a rare endemic species.
